Morrissey Betty Meyer Ron Payne David Carr Ronnie Bon nie Burns Michael Green Dorothy Dottie Mar bach Rick Cotterman Frances Carr Kelsey Peters and Tom Richhart 5TH SUNDAY OF LENT MARCH 18TH 2018 YR BODILY PENANCE LEADS TO BETTER AND GLORIFIED LIFE IT IS LIFE OF TRANSFORMATION AND TRANSFIGURATION IT IS ETERNAL LIFE IN CHRIST My dear brothers and sisters in Christ the Lord be with you I wish you all Happy St Joseph Feast Day tomorrow Monday March 19th 2018 our Patron Saint Bodily Penance etc as stated above is true for those who keep Gods commandments and live out their Baptismal commitment with the Lord That is the reason the Lord God says in the 1st Reading Jer 313134 The days are coming says the Lord our God when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel The new covenant was made in Christ through Baptism It is to destroy sin that Christ was born He suffered and died and of course rose We need to be loyal to God Disloyalty disobedience destroys the life of Christ in us God in His infinite wisdom wrote his commandment in our hearts and not on the tablets of stone Why was the Commandment written on the tablets of stone This is your assignment take home question In the 2nd Reading Heb 579 the author of the letter to the Hebrews wrote that Christ offered prayers and supplications with loud cries and tears to God for our sins and the pains of suffering he was to undergo to save us from death of sin was too heavy on him The experience of abandonment our sins caused Christ great pains that he bled blood in the garden of Gethsemane Let us avoid sin so that we do not again cause Him this kind of unbearable pains In the Gospel Jn 122033 Philip and Andrew led some people to Jesus Think about it How many people have you led to Jesus In this Gospel story we see the mystery of abiding in Christ The grain of wheat which falls to the ground and dies in order to produce an abundance of grains which transcends itself in both quantity and quality so shall we be transformed in quality in Christ if we live in Christ and be faithful to our Baptismal promises Thus to hate oneself or lose ones life means to be willing to give up conveniences and accept inconveniences in life for the sake of Christ It is surrendering oneself to God for the sake of our neighbor For our salva tion we need one another We need to help one another as some Greeks needed the help of Philip to see Jesus Philip needed the assistance of Andrew and both helped those and they saw Jesus As the Greeks needed Jesus so we need Him Let us go to him for our salvation Let us not fear death For all of us will face death It is unavoid able and necessary end Death is not annihilation of the human person but a transfor mation resulting in a glorious resurrection What we need to fear is sin which de stroys life Question Why was the commandment written on two tablets of stone It was written on two tablets of stone for one tablet is in relation to God the other is in relation to one another Why was the commandment written on tablets of stone It was written on stone so that you either keep it or you break it otherwise the sons and daughters of Adam and Eve will not be able to bend the Commandments of God God bless you Rev Msgr Pius Ilechukwu NB 1 Every Second and Last Thursday of the month Msgr Pius Ilechukwu goes around our Parish visiting our parishioners who are Sick the Aged and Homebound and administer the Sacrament of Holy Communion Confessions or Anointing He also visits Nursing homes Hospitals etc where our parishioner are hospitalized On the last Thursday of the month he celebrates Holy at River Ter race Estate and goes around again administering the Sacrament as there are needs Pleas if you know any parishioner who needs visit please do not hesitate to con tact Msgr Pius or the Parish Office (260)824-1380 Thanks and God bless you Again every Sunday 4 of our Extra Ordinary Eucharistic Ministers for Home bound drive around our parish to give Holy Communion to those parishioners Thus there is great need for more Extraordinary Eucharistic Ministers for the Homebound Please if you are willing to help contact Msgr Pius or Parish office at (260)824-1380 If you know any parishioner who needs visit do not hesitate to contact him or the Parish Office at the same phone number Thanks and God bless you NB Heaven is for us all I hope you are doing something about it Many people will walk in and out of your life only true friends will leave footprints in your heart The amount needed each week to make budget is 511640 We are 77340 behind budget from last week Other Collections within our Parish St Vincent de Paul 66500 Diocesan Special Collections Catholic Relief 33400 Thank you for your gifts to St Josephs Collection for Weekend of Michael Christine Zadylak May God welcome them home Fill them with peace and bless those who will miss them Eternal Rest Grant unto them Lord and let Perpetual light shine upon them May their souls and the souls of all the faithful departed through the mercy of God rest in Peace Amen SCRIPTUREMASS READINGS FOR THE WEEK Mon Mar 19 Fifth Week of Lent St Joseph Spouse of the Blessed Virgin Mary 2 STEWARDSHIP CORNER God wants us to invest our time in that which counts for eternity making the most of every opportunity because the days are evil Eph 516 PARISH CALENDAR FOR MARCHAPRIL 1 2018 Sun Mar 25 Palm Sunday Holy Week Begins Tues Mar 27 Chrism Mass Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception Fort Wayne 7:30pm Thurs Mar 29 Holy Thursday Mass 7:00pm followed by Exposition of the Blessed Sacrament until Midnight Fri Mar 30 Good Friday The Passion of the Lord Service at 1:00pm Sat Mar 31 Holy Saturday Vigil Mass 8:30pm Sun Apr 1 Easter Sunday Masses 730 and 10:00am PLEASE NOTE Mass at River Terrace Estates Visitation of the Sick and Homebound is being moved from March 29 Holy Thursday to Wednesday March 28 at 10:30am Thank you MARK YOUR CALENDARS The Alpha Eta Chapter of Psi Iota Xi will hold its annual Basket Bag Bingo Night on Monday April 23 at St Josephs Bluffton Doors open at 5:45pm and games begin at 7:00pm 20 for 20 games Food will be available for purchase There will be two raffles for Grand Prizes Phone Jennifer at (419)230-8068 or email redjen686gmail.com to reserve your seats This event fills up quickly There have been a few parishioners who have shown an interest in becoming Litur gical Ministers ie Lectors Proclaimers of the Word of God Extraordinary Min isters of Holy Communion and Ministers of Hospitality Training will begin soon for these ministries so please call the Parish office 8241380 if you are interested as well Please remember these 8th Grade Students in your prayers as they are to be Confirmed in the Holy Spirit on Tuesday April 3rd at 7:00pm at St Marys Decatur They are Allison Bear daughter of Anthony Sara Bear Caden Clifton son of Amy Kobryn Elizabeth Geisel daughter of Tim Donna Geisel Wyatt Girod son of Kevin
